result.execSummary:
The defendant Laymon Quendell Price was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Kidnapping/Carry w/o Consent [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.31(1)(a).
  • 1st Deg. Sexual Assault-Use/Dang.Weapon, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(b).
  • 1st Deg. Sexual Assault-Use/Dang.Weapon, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(b).
  • 1st Deg. Sexual Assault-Use/Dang.Weapon, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(b).
  • 1st Deg. Sexual Assault-Use/Dang.Weapon, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(b).
  • Kidnapping/Seize or Confine w/o Consent [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.31(1)(b).
  • 1st Deg. Sexual Assault-Use/Dang.Weapon, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(b).
  • Kidnapping/Seize or Confine w/o Consent [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.31(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.
Consecutive to: to Counts 7 & 8, concurrent to Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, & 6.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with the victims or their families, their place of residence, employment or school. No contact includes no thirs party contact. 
No access to internet during period of initial confinement.
No use of social media accounts.

Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay DNA surcharge on each count.
Register and comply with the sex offender registry.
Obtain/comply with sex offender treatment.
Participate in a cognitive therapy class at the institution.
Participate in a psychological evaluation in order for the agent to determine treatment needs.
If defendant owns any electronic devises with internet capabilities, it is to be made available to agent for inspection upon demand.

supervisions.notes: Restitution total of $1696.09 to be devided first to Yshaunda G. $380.00; $1316.09 to Crime Victim Comp. Program.
Consecutive to: to Counts 7 & 8, concurrent to Counts 1, 3, 4, 5, & 6.

superMiscConds.notes: See Count 1 for Extended Supervision conditions

records.addlTxt: per order dated September 23, 2016, Appeal 2015AP2562CR, the hold previously imposed in this matter is lifted and this appeal may continue. Atty. Bonneson's motion to withdraw as counsel for Price is denied. The deadline for Price to file his opening brief and appendix is extended through October 24, 2016.

per order dated July 18, 2016, Appeal 2015AP2562CR, the further proceedings in this appeal are stayed until further order of this court. Laymon Quendell Price shall submit a letter to this court indicating whether he has retained counsel no later than September 12, 2016. If Price retains counsel, counsel should file a notice of appearance within five days of being retained. Paul Bonneson's motion to withdraw is held in abeyance pending further order of this court.

Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in court with attorney Scott Mcclune.  Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
At the hour of 12:20 p.m. the jury returned. Court reviewed the verdict forms and sent the jury back to the jury room to complete COUNT 8. Jury back in court and, by their foreperson, brought in verdicts of GUILTY as to counts 1-8 which were then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. 

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing. 

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. Exhibit list received and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25. 

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Scott Mcclune in court, defendant Laymon Quendell Price not in court, in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Jury deliberations continued at the hour of 8:30 a.m. Jury question received at 8:43 a.m., jury question received and filed. State will make copies of specific photos the jury requested from the DVD exhibits. Packet of photos contained on Exhibit 7 was marked as Exhibit 7A and received into the record. Packet of photos contained on Exhibit 4 were marked as Exhibit 4A and received into the record. Exhibits sent back to the jury. Deliberations continued. Second jury question received at 11:46 a.m. and filed. Court responded to the jury question. Deliberations continued.

Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in court with attorney Scott Mcclune.  Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Discussion regarding jury instructions. Jury in the box: 1:51 p.m. Closing arguments by the State. Jury out of the box: 3:25 p.m. Jury in the box: 3:43 p.m. Closing arguments by the defense and state. Court charged the jury.  Alternate jurors selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 4:34 p.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Terrell & Sanfilitpo who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Court released the jurors at 5:00 p.m. Deliberations to continue at 8:30 a.m. on 6/27/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in court with attorney Scott Mcclune.  Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Defendant knowingly and voluntarily elects to testify. Discussion regarding prior convictions of the defendant. Jury in the box: 9:56 a.m. Sworn for the defense: William P. Jury out of the box. Sidebar placed on the record. Jury in the box: 10:20 a.m. Sworn for the defense: Laymon Price. Jury out of the box: 11:39 a.m. Jury in the box: 11:49 a.m. Defense rests. State proceeded with rebuttal. Previously videotaped testimony of Milwaukee Police Officer Gary Brown marked as Exhibit 8 played for the jury. State rests. Testimony closed. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 12:09 p.m. Case adjourned to 1:30 p.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.
Court ordered body attachment canceled for Ashley Shatara Hopkins. Copy of cancellation warrant signed and filed.

Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in court with attorney Scott Mcclune.  Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Jury in the box: 1:10 p.m. Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Daniel Urban, Crime Lab Analyst Ronald Witucky, Milwaukee Police Investigator Angela Phillips. Jury out of the box: 1:48 p.m. Discussion regarding State's remaining witnesses. One witness is refusing to cooperate and is not present in court. State requests body attachment for defaulting witness. Defense objects. Court issued a body attachment for defaulting witness Ashley Hopkins and ordered witness remanded to the Court. Bench warrant signed and filed. Witness subpoena received and filed. Exhibits 4-9, 11-14, 16 & 17 received. Defense counsel made oral motion for dismissal and mistrial. Additional arguments heard. Court denied defense motion for dismissal and motion for mistrial. Case passed to locate defaulting witness. Case recalled. Appearances remain the same. Jury in the box: 2:49 p.m. Sworn for the State: Ashley Hopkins, DNA Analyst Lisa Treffinger, Milwaukee Police Investigator Angela Phillips. Exhibit 18 received. State rests subject to rebuttal. Sworn for the defense: Andrea J., Charles B. Exhibits 19 & 20 received. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 4:03 p.m. Defense counsel renewed motion for dismissal which the Court denied. Court vacated warrant for defaulting witness Ashley Hopkins. Case adjourned to 9:30 a.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.

Body attachment issued for defaulting witness Ashley Shatara Hopkins. State's court officer Milwaukee Police Investigator Angela Phillips left the courtroom to serve the warrant on the defaulting witness.   COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in court with attorney Scott Mcclune.  Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Exhibit 8 received by the Court to be kept in the court file. Jury in the box: 9:01 a.m. Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Brian Pinter, Milwaukee Police Investigator Angela Phillips, DOJ Crime Lab Analyst Aric Reilly. Jury out of the box: 10:20 a.m. Jury in the box: 10:35 a.m. Sworn for the State: Sexual Assault Nurse Examiner Eve Meyer, Ayesha M. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 12:03 p.m. Sidebar placed on the record. Court will hear additional arguments as to exhibits the State moved into evidence at a later time. Case adjourned to 1:00 p.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.

Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in court with attorney Scott Mcclune.  Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Jury in the box: 1:24 p.m. Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Gary Brown, Sexual Assault Nurse Examiner Alison Lopez, DNA Analyst Sharon Polakowski. Jury out of the box: 2:44 p.m. Jury in the box: 3:03 p.m. Sworn for the State: Brittney T. Court instructed the jury. Jury out of the box: 4:10 p.m. Case adjourned 6/25/14 at 9:00 a.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.

Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in court with attorney Scott Mcclune.  Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Additional arguments heard as to State's request to videotape testimony of Officer Brown regarding the alibi investigation. Court will allow video testimony of Officer Brown to be taken. Jury in the box: 9:22 a.m. Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Gary Brown. Exhibit 3 received. Sworn for the State: Yshaunda G. Jury out of the box: 10:35 a.m. Jury in the box: 10:54 a.m. Continued testimony of Yshaunda G. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 11:36 a.m. Court ordered videotaped testimony be taken. An employee of the Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office in court to record the testimony. Testimony proceeded. Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Gary Brown. Videotaped testimony concluded. Discussion regarding scheduling. Court ordered the State to produce an unedited copy of the videotaped testimony to the Court prior to playing it for the jury. Sidebar placed on the record. Case adjourned to 1:15 p.m. for continuation of jury trial.

Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in court with attorney Scott Mcclune.  Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Jury selection continued. Jury panel in the box: 1:42 p.m. Voir dire continued. Court held in chambers discussion with both parties. Continued voir dire. Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn. Jury out of the box: 2:35 p.m. Jury list received and filed. Court ordered witness sequestration. Jury in the box: 2:54 p.m. Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Gary Brown. Court held sidebar with both parties. Continued testimony of Officer Brown. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 4:51 p.m. In chambers discussions placed on the record. Court deferred ruling on State's witness until tomorrow morning. Case adjourned to 6/24/14 at 9:00 a.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.

Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in court with attorney Scott Mcclune.  Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Parties are prepared to proceed. Discussion regarding defense's motion to limit the number of State's witnesses. Additional arguments heard as to motion. Court made rulings on specific witnesses the State intends to call in reference to the other acts evidence. State placed offer on the record. Case passed to retrieve jury panel. Case recalled. Appearances remain the same. Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 10:44 a.m. Court instructed jury. Jury panel out of the box: 11:57 a.m. Case adjourned to 1:15 p.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.
State's Response to Defendant's "Motion in Limine - Other Acts Witnesses" received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Order Regarding Witnesses signed and filed. State to respond with any objection to the Defense request and the legal grounds therefore by June 19, 2014 or any such objection shall be deemed waived. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
DEFENDANT'S MOTION IN LIMINE- OTHER ACTS WITNESSES

Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in court with attorney Scott Mcclune.  Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Discussion regarding witness lists and jury instructions submitted by the parties. State has turned over investigative report results in regards to the defendant's notice of alibi. State will also submit an offer to the defense. Additional arguments heard as to State's request to introduce other acts. Court GRANTED State's motion for reasons placed on the record. Parties will meet to discuss witness lists and determine whose testimony will be relevant. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 06/23/2014. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in court with attorney Scott Ryan McClune.  Defendant Laymon Quendell Price in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Arguments heard as to defense motion to adjourn jury trial. State does not object. Court GRANTED defense request for adjournment of jury trial. Discussion regarding Other Acts motion. Defense is not prepared to proceed today, will be requesting transcripts from previous jury trial (11CF3871). Discussion regarding defense motion to sever. Arguments heard as to motion to sever. Court DENIED defense motion to sever for reasons placed on the record. COUNTS 1-8 remain joined. Arguments heard as to defense motion to suppress defendant's consent to give DNA. Court DENIED defense motion to suppress DNA for reasons placed on the record. Court vacated jury trial date of 04/21/2014 and final pretrial date of 03/31/2014. Defendant WAIVES speedy trial demand. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.
